name: Curd and Chole Salad
recipe: Mix boiled chole with low-fat curd, diced cucumber, grated carrot, chopped onion, diced tomato, and shredded cabbage. Season with roasted cumin powder and a pinch of rock salt. Serve chilled.

name: Sprouted Moong and Cucumber Salad
recipe: Combine sprouted moong, chopped cucumber, tomato, and onion. Add lemon juice, black salt, and chopped coriander. Serve fresh. Avoid adding any sugar or sweet chutneys.

name: Besan and Methi Chilla
recipe: Make a batter with besan, chopped methi leaves, green chili, turmeric, ajwain, and onion. Cook on a non-stick pan with minimal oil. Serve with mint chutney.

name: Low GI Vegetable Stir-Fry
recipe: Lightly stir-fry the vegetables in olive oil with crushed garlic and black pepper. Cook until tender but not mushy. Serve warm.

name: Lauki Moong Dal Soup
recipe: Pressure cook lauki and moong dal with turmeric. Blend slightly and temper with cumin and grated ginger. Avoid adding ghee or butter.

name: Ragi Vegetable Dosa
recipe: Make a batter using ragi flour and curd. Mix in grated vegetables and spices. Cook on a hot pan with minimal oil. Serve with tomato or mint chutney.

name: Karela (Bitter Gourd) Stir-Fry
recipe: Thinly slice karela and soak in salt water for 30 mins. Sauté with onions, turmeric, mustard seeds, and amchur powder until cooked and lightly crisp. Do not deep-fry.

name: Vegetable Oats Upma
recipe: Dry roast oats. In a pan, temper mustard seeds and curry leaves, sauté chopped veggies, add oats, water, and salt. Cook until soft. Avoid adding ghee or coconut.

name: Palak Tofu Bhurji
recipe: Crumble tofu and sauté with chopped spinach, onion, tomato, and spices. Great source of protein with low carbs and zero cholesterol.

name: Masala Buttermilk
recipe: Blend low-fat curd with water, add roasted cumin powder, chopped mint, coriander, and a pinch of salt. Serve chilled. A refreshing drink that also aids digestion and controls blood sugar spikes.

name: Spinach (Palak) Cheela
recipe: Make a batter using besan, finely chopped spinach, green chili, ginger, turmeric, ajwain, and water. Cook on a non-stick pan with minimal oil until golden on both sides.

name: Mashed Chickpea Tikkis
recipe: Mash chickpeas with grated carrot, onion, green chili, and spices. Add flaxseed powder as a binder. Shape into tikkis and shallow fry in a non-stick pan until crispy.

name: Vegetable Quinoa Pulao
recipe: Cook quinoa separately. In a pan, sauté vegetables with cumin and turmeric. Mix in cooked quinoa and stir well. Serve warm.

name: Methi Thepla (Diabetic-friendly)
recipe: Knead dough with whole wheat flour, chopped methi, turmeric, carom seeds, and curd. Roll into thin theplas and cook on a tawa using minimal oil.

name: Cauliflower Rice Stir-fry
recipe: Grate cauliflower to form rice-like texture. Stir-fry with vegetables, garlic, and ginger in olive oil. Cook until tender. Avoid adding soy sauce or sugar.

name: Stuffed Lauki Paratha
recipe: Mix grated lauki with wheat flour and spices. Roll into parathas and cook on tawa with little oil. Serve with low-fat curd.

name: Tofu and Mixed Veg Curry
recipe: Sauté vegetables and tofu with ginger, garlic, and tomato puree. Add turmeric, cumin, and coriander powder. Simmer until cooked. Serve with roti or quinoa.

name: Kuttu (Buckwheat) Pancakes
recipe: Mix all ingredients into a thick batter. Pour on a non-stick pan to form pancakes. Cook both sides using minimal oil.

name: Mixed Lentil Soup
recipe: Cook lentils until soft. Blend slightly and temper with garlic, turmeric, and black pepper. Garnish with coriander. A wholesome, fiber-rich soup.

name: Low-Carb Paneer Bhurji Lettuce Wrap
recipe: Prepare paneer bhurji using minimal oil. Serve wrapped in large lettuce leaves as a nutritious, low-carb alternative to roti or bread.

name: Vegetable Poha
recipe: Lightly wash and drain flattened rice. In a pan, temper mustard seeds, then add chopped onions, peas, and carrots. Sauté until tender. Add the flattened rice, season with salt and turmeric, and a squeeze of lemon juice. Mix well and serve hot.

name: Masoor Dal with Brown Rice
recipe: Cook masoor dal with chopped tomatoes, garlic, and turmeric until soft. Temper with cumin seeds. Serve with cooked brown rice.

name: Palak Tofu Curry
recipe: Prepare a smooth spinach puree. Sauté tofu cubes until golden. In a pan, combine the spinach puree with sautéed tofu and your preferred spices (e.g., cumin powder, coriander powder, a pinch of garam masala). Simmer until the flavors meld.

name: Moong Dal Chilla with Mint Chutney
recipe: Grind soaked moong dal with green chili, ginger, and coriander to make a smooth batter. Cook thin pancakes (chilla) on a non-stick pan with minimal oil. Serve with fresh mint chutney.

name: Quinoa Khichdi
recipe: Combine quinoa, moong dal, chopped carrot, and peas in a pressure cooker. Add water, turmeric, and salt. Cook until done. Serve hot.

name: Oats Upma
recipe: Dry roast rolled oats. In a pan, temper mustard seeds and curry leaves. Add chopped vegetables (like onions, carrots, peas) and sauté. Add the roasted oats, water, and salt. Cook until the oats are soft and the water is absorbed.

name: Tofu & Mixed Veg Curry
recipe: Sauté cubed tofu and mixed vegetables (beans, carrots) in a pan. Add tomato puree and a blend of spices (e.g., turmeric, cumin, coriander). Simmer until the vegetables are tender and the curry thickens.

name: Curds & Chole Salad
recipe: Combine boiled chickpeas with low-fat curd, diced carrots, chopped tomato, and shredded cabbage. Season with salt, pepper, and a touch of roasted cumin powder. Mix well and serve chilled.

name: Mixed Lentil Soup + Salad
recipe: Cook moong and masoor dal until soft. Season with sautéed garlic, turmeric, and black pepper. Blend lightly for a smoother consistency. Serve hot.

name: Paneer/Tofu and Veg Stir-Fry
recipe: Heat oil in a pan. Add chopped broccoli, zucchini, and capsicum. Sauté with minced garlic until the vegetables are tender-crisp. Season with salt and pepper.

name: Ragi Dosa (repeat with variation or chutney)
ingredients: different chutney like coconut or tomato
recipe: Prepare Ragi Dosa as per breakfast recipe. Serve with a different chutney, such as a fresh coconut chutney or a tangy tomato chutney, for variety.
